comments.body: Basically I agree. So far, we did not have any issues with `Random` introducing flakiness that we cannot reproduce. However, I am not sure if `seed = new Random().nextLong()` is a good seed -- isn't this also deterministic? I am used to `seed = System.currentTimeMillis()` ?
no, it's only a success if *all* the checks pass. So I think it's correct as an "and". Does that seem right?

Ack. I guess I mixed up old code and new code -- also the comment `give it one more try if it's not already passing` is confusing. The interplay between `verificationResult.passed()` and `success` seems a little convoluted.

Decomponsed `verifySuppressed` and `verify`, so that we can just verify that `sws-suppressed` is actually suppressed, without verifying the results (which we would have to compute from first principles)
the second cast is unnecessary to prevent overflow
